nodes.text: The Bogan Collection, also known as the Archive of Forbidden Artifacts, was a hidden vault of forbidden artifacts associated with the dark side of the Force within the archives of the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. It notably contained ancient Sith scrolls and swords, other Sith relics such as the lightsaber of Darth Krall, artifacts relating to the Sorcerers of Tund and the Yacombe, and the helmet of the Sith Lord Darth Momin. Padawan Klias Teradine discovered the Bogan Collection during the High Republic Era, and was subsequently expelled from the Jedi Order. Dooku and Sifo-Dyas broke into the Bogan Collection together when they were initiates at the Temple.

The term "Bogan" originates from the second draft of what would become Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope. In the draft, Bogan refers to evil and the antithesis of "Ashla," or good. Bogan was later introduced to Star Wars canon by Star Wars Rebels: Steps Into Shadow as an alternative name for the dark side of the Force.
